revised_title: Radiation from a Moving Mirror in Two-Dimensional Space-Time
tldr: The authors calculate the energy-momentum tensor in a two-dimensional quantum theory of a massless scalar field influenced by the motion of a perfectly reflecting boundary (mirror). They find that the vacuum expectation value of the tensor exhibits a non-vanishing radiation flux for an arbitrary mirror trajectory. The calculation requires a regularization procedure of covariant separation of points along time-like geodesics. The study of this simple model system provides insight into more sophisticated processes, such as particle production in cosmological models and exploding black holes.
